title: Makes possession and sale of embalming fluid a misdemeanor
summary: Makes possession and sale of embalming fluid a misdemeanor.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3964

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 31, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. MAGNARELLI, FINCH -- read once and referred to
         the Committee on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the penal law and public  health  law,  in  relation  to
         criminal possession and unlawful sale of embalming fluid

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The penal law is amended by adding a new section 220.78  to
    2  read as follows:
    3  S 220.78 CRIMINAL POSSESSION OF EMBALMING FLUID.
    4    1.  A  PERSON IS GUILTY OF CRIMINAL POSSESSION OF EMBALMING FLUID WHEN
    5  HE OR SHE KNOWINGLY POSSESSES EMBALMING FLUID WITH THE  INTENT:  (A)  TO
    6  USE  SUCH EMBALMING FLUID FOR PURPOSES OF HUMAN INGESTION OR INHALATION;
    7  OR (B) TO SELL SUCH EMBALMING FLUID  TO  ANOTHER  PERSON  UNDER  CIRCUM-
    8  STANCES  EVINCING  KNOWLEDGE  THAT  SUCH  OTHER PERSON OR A THIRD PERSON
    9  INTENDS TO USE SUCH EMBALMING FLUID FOR PURPOSES OF HUMAN  INGESTION  OR
   10  INHALATION.
   11    2. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "EMBALMING FLUID" MEANS ANY CHEMICALS
   12  OR  SUBSTANCES MANUFACTURED PRIMARILY FOR USE BY LICENSED FUNERAL DIREC-
   13  TORS, UNDERTAKERS OR EMBALMERS, OR  REGISTERED  RESIDENTS,  TO  PREPARE,
   14  DISINFECT OR PRESERVE, EITHER HYPODERMICALLY, ARTERIALLY OR BY ANY OTHER
   15  RECOGNIZED  MEANS THE BODY OF A DECEASED PERSON FOR BURIAL, CREMATION OR
   16  OTHER FINAL DISPOSITION.
   17    CRIMINAL POSSESSION OF EMBALMING FLUID IS A CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.
   18    S 2. Section 3400 of the public health law is amended by adding a  new
   19  subdivision (l) to read as follows:
   20    (L)  "EMBALMING  FLUID" MEANS ANY CHEMICALS OR SUBSTANCES MANUFACTURED
   21  PRIMARILY FOR USE BY LICENSED FUNERAL DIRECTORS, UNDERTAKERS  OR  EMBAL-
   22  MERS, OR REGISTERED RESIDENTS, TO PREPARE, DISINFECT OR PRESERVE, EITHER
   23  HYPODERMICALLY,  ARTERIALLY OR BY ANY OTHER RECOGNIZED MEANS THE BODY OF
   24  A DECEASED PERSON FOR BURIAL, CREMATION OR OTHER FINAL DISPOSITION.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03275-01-1

       A. 3964                             2

    1    S 3. Paragraph (f) of subdivision 1 of  section  3455  of  the  public
    2  health  law is relettered paragraph (g) and a new paragraph (f) is added
    3  to read as follows:
    4    (F)  BEING  A  FUNERAL DIRECTOR, UNDERTAKER OR EMBALMER, OR REGISTERED
    5  RESIDENT, KNOWINGLY GIVE, SELL, PERMIT TO BE SOLD,  OFFER  FOR  SALE  OR
    6  DISPLAY  FOR  SALE,  OTHER THAN FOR PURPOSES WITHIN THE GENERAL SCOPE OF
    7  THEIR ACTIVITIES AS A LICENSED FUNERAL DIRECTOR, UNDERTAKER OR EMBALMER,
    8  OR REGISTERED RESIDENT, EMBALMING FLUID TO ANOTHER  PERSON  WITH  ACTUAL
    9  KNOWLEDGE  THAT  SUCH  OTHER  PERSON IS NOT A LICENSED FUNERAL DIRECTOR,
   10  UNDERTAKER OR EMBALMER, OR REGISTERED RESIDENT, OR ENTITY AUTHORIZED  TO
   11  PERFORM EMBALMING ACTIVITIES UNDER SECTION THIRTY-FOUR HUNDRED TWENTY OF
   12  THIS  ARTICLE OR ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN ARTICLE FORTY-TWO OF THIS CHAP-
   13  TER; OR
   14    S 4. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   15  it shall have become a law.
